flask_permissions package¶

Submodules¶

flask_permissions.core module¶

class flask_permissions.core.Permissions(app, local_db, current_user)[source]¶

Bases: object

Grabs data from the developer needed for the functionality of the Flask-Permissions extension

init_app(app, local_db, current_user)[source]¶

flask_permissions.decorators module¶

flask_permissions.decorators.import_user()¶

Attempts to import the Flask-Login current_user proxy

Returns:
The Flask-Login current_user proxy.
flask_permissions.decorators.user_has(ability, user=None)[source]¶

Prevents access to a route unless the user has the given ability.

Args:
ability: The string name of the ability to test. user: (Optional) The user object to test for the given ability. If omitted, the function will attempt to import the Flask-Login current_user.
Returns:
The decorated function.
flask_permissions.decorators.user_is(role, user=None)[source]¶

Prevents access to a route unless the user has the given role.

Args:
role: The string name of the role to test. user: (Optional) The user object to test for the given role. If omitted, the function will attempt to import the Flask-Login current_user.
Returns:
The decorated function.

flask_permissions.models module¶

class flask_permissions.models.Ability(name)[source]¶

Bases: flask_sqlalchemy.Model

Class for role abilities

This very basic abilities class may be subclassed if you need it to store additional information.

Attributes:
id: An integer primary key for database name: A string naming the ability
id None¶
name None¶
class flask_permissions.models.Role(name)[source]¶

Bases: flask_sqlalchemy.Model

Class for user roles

This very basic roles class may be subclassed if you need it to store additional information.

Attributes:
id: An integer primary key for database name: A string naming the role abilities: A relationship linking to the Ability object
abilities None¶
add_abilities(*abilities)[source]¶

Adds relationships to existing or new abilities to the Role object.

Args:
*abilities: A variable number of string ability names to be associated with the Role object.
id None¶
name None¶
remove_abilities(*abilities)[source]¶

Removes relationships to abilities from the Role object.

Args:
*abilities: A variable number of string ability names to be removed from the Role object.
class flask_permissions.models.UserMixin(roles=None, default_role='user')[source]¶

Bases: flask_sqlalchemy.Model

Mixin for the user class

Sub-class your user object from this class. You may want to add information the user will utilize to login such as a username, email address, and password.

Attributes:
id: An integer primary key for database roles: A relationship linking to the Ability object
add_roles(*roles)[source]¶

Adds relationships to existing or new roles to the user object.

Args:
*roles: A variable number of string role names to be associated with the user object.

is_authenticated()[source]¶
remove_roles(*roles)[source]¶

Removes relationships to roles from the user object.

Args:
*roles: A variable number of string role names to be removed from the user object.

flask_permissions.utils module¶

flask_permissions.utils.is_sequence(arg)[source]¶

Determines if the passed value is a sequence but not a string

Args:
arg: The variable to be tested.
Returns:
A boolean that is true if the variable is a sequence but not a string, false otherwise
